page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: There are 281 houses in the area. Of these 79 are owned by the Kennet District Council,21 are tied to a job,and 181 are privately owned. Fifty one of the properties are bungalows and 12 are maisonettes. Building styles vary in the village and a variety of materials have been used. Many of the older houses were built of flint with thatched roofs; there are still a few houses with cob and wattle and daub walls.A group of these older houses can be seen in Sunton, and it is hoped to keep this section of the village unspoilt. Some plans have been sent in to build more houses but most of the villagers think that there are enough houses already. Others feel that houses for young families should be built as young people now have to move away.
